territory.notes: Established as the Civil Territory of Mauritania in 1904. Some sources indicate a French protectorate was declared over portions or all of the same area in 1902 or perhaps even 1901. Although established as its own territory and in its own name in 1904 (and included in its own name as a constituent part of French West Africa in 1920), it appears Mauritania remained administratively linked to the French colony of Senegal until 1946. Mauritania formally became a constituent part of French West Africa (Afrique Occidentale Française) on December 4, 1920. It became a French Overseas Territory in 1946, which afforded greater forms of self-governance; it was also administratively separated from Senegal in the same year. Mauritania became independent from France on November 28, 1960.
